biocontainers.name: catastrophy
biocontainers.summary: CATAStrophy is a classification method for describing lifestyles/trophic characteristics of filamentous plant pathogens using carbohydrate-active enzymes (CAZymes).

biotools.summary: CATAStrophy is a classification method for describing lifestyles/trophic characteristics of filamentous plant pathogens using carbohydrate-active enzymes (CAZymes). The name CATAStrophy is a backronym portmanteau hybrid where "CATAS" means CAZyme Assisted Training And Sorting.

bioschemas.name: CATAStrophy
bioschemas.summary: CATAStrophy is a classification method for describing lifestyles/trophic characteristics of filamentous plant pathogens using carbohydrate-active enzymes (CAZymes). The name CATAStrophy is a backronym portmanteau hybrid where "CATAS" means CAZyme Assisted Training And Sorting.
